host.description: The host domain of the snowflake instance (must include the account, region, cloud environment, and end with snowflakecomputing.com). The account identifier differs depending on your cloud region, be sure to verify with Snowflake's documentation.
host.title: Host

role.description: The role you created for Airbyte to access Snowflake.
role.title: Role

warehouse.description: The warehouse you created for Airbyte to sync data into.
warehouse.title: Warehouse

database.description: The database you created for Airbyte to sync data into.
database.title: Database

schema.description: The default schema is used as the target schema for all statements issued from the connection that do not explicitly specify a schema name.. Schema name would be transformed to allowed by Snowflake if it not follow Snowflake Naming Conventions https://docs.airbyte.io/integrations/destinations/snowflake#notes-about-snowflake-naming-conventions
schema.title: Default Schema

username.description: The username you created to allow Airbyte to access the database.
username.title: Username

client_id.title: Client ID
client_id.description: The Client ID of your Drift developer application.

client_secret.title: Client Secret
client_secret.description: The Client Secret of your Drift developer application.

access_token.title: Access Token
access_token.description: Access Token for making authenticated requests.

refresh_token.title: Refresh Token
refresh_token.description: Refresh Token for making authenticated requests.

password.description: The password associated with the username.
password.title: Password

jdbc_url_params.description: Additional properties to pass to the JDBC URL string when connecting to the database formatted as 'key=value' pairs separated by the symbol '&'. (example: key1=value1&key2=value2&key3=value3).
jdbc_url_params.title: JDBC URL Params

loading_method.title: Loading Method
loading_method.description: The loading method used to send data to Snowflake.

oneOf.title: [Recommended] Internal Staging
oneOf.description:
Writes large batches of records to a file, uploads the file to Snowflake, then uses 
COPY INTO table
to upload the file. Recommended for large production workloads for better speed and scalability.

oneOf.title: AWS S3 Staging
oneOf.description:
Writes large batches of records to a file, uploads the file to S3, then uses 
COPY INTO table
to upload the file. Recommended for large production workloads for better speed and scalability.

s3_bucket_name.title: S3 Bucket Name
s3_bucket_name.description:
The name of the staging S3 bucket. Airbyte will write files to this bucket and read them via 
COPY
statements on Snowflake.

s3_bucket_region.title: S3 Bucket Region
s3_bucket_region.description: The region of the S3 staging bucket which is used when utilising a copy strategy.

access_key_id.description: The Access Key Id granting allow one to access the above S3 staging bucket. Airbyte requires Read and Write permissions to the given bucket.
access_key_id.title: S3 Key Id

secret_access_key.description: The corresponding secret to the above access key id.
secret_access_key.title: S3 Access Key

purge_staging_data.title: Purge Staging Files and Tables
purge_staging_data.description: Whether to delete the staging files from S3 after completing the sync. See the docs for details. Only relevant for COPY. Defaults to true.

encryption.title: Encryption
encryption.description: How to encrypt the staging data

oneOf.title: No encryption
oneOf.description: Staging data will be stored in plaintext.

oneOf.title: AES-CBC envelope encryption
oneOf.description: Staging data will be encrypted using AES-CBC envelope encryption.

key_encrypting_key.title: Key
key_encrypting_key.description: The key, base64-encoded. Must be either 128, 192, or 256 bits. Leave blank to have Airbyte generate an ephemeral key for each sync.

oneOf.title: GCS Staging
oneOf.description:
Writes large batches of records to a file, uploads the file to GCS, then uses 
COPY INTO table
to upload the file. Recommended for large production workloads for better speed and scalability.

project_id.title: GCP Project ID
project_id.description: The name of the GCP project ID for your credentials.

bucket_name.title: GCS Bucket Name
bucket_name.description:
The name of the staging GCS bucket. Airbyte will write files to this bucket and read them via 
COPY
statements on Snowflake.

credentials_json.title: Google Application Credentials
credentials_json.description: The contents of the JSON key file that has read/write permissions to the staging GCS bucket. You will separately need to grant bucket access to your Snowflake GCP service account. See the GCP docs for more information on how to generate a JSON key for your service account.

oneOf.title: Azure Blob Storage Staging
oneOf.description:
Writes large batches of records to a file, uploads the file to Azure Blob Storage, then uses 
COPY INTO table
to upload the file. Recommended for large production workloads for better speed and scalability.

azure_blob_storage_endpoint_domain_name.title: Endpoint Domain Name
azure_blob_storage_endpoint_domain_name.description: This is Azure Blob Storage endpoint domain name. Leave default value (or leave it empty if run container from command line) to use Microsoft native from example.

azure_blob_storage_account_name.title: Azure Blob Storage Account Name
azure_blob_storage_account_name.description: The account's name of the Azure Blob Storage.

azure_blob_storage_container_name.title: Azure blob storage container (Bucket) Name
azure_blob_storage_container_name.description: The name of the Azure blob storage container. *This needs to coincide with the container specified in the Snowflake Storage Integration and Snowflake Azure External Stage (see description of 'Snowflake Azure External Stage' for details

azure_blob_storage_sas_token.title: SAS Token
azure_blob_storage_sas_token.description: Shared access signature(SAS) token to grant Snowflake limited access to objects in your storage account. See more https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-load-azure-config.html#option-2-generating-a-sas-token
